intro: Melicope subunifoliolata, commonly known as the single-leaf melicope, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically has a compact growth habit with thick, leathery foliage that can vary in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests or rocky areas. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it of interest in horticulture and traditional medicine.
